com.github.bwsoft.iris.message

Class SBEMessageSchema

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.bwsoft.iris.message.SBEMessageSchema

  • public class SBEMessageSchema
extends java.lang.Object
    A factory class to create SBE messages within a scope of a message schema. A SBE message schema contains a collection of SBE messages that are defined within a SBE XML file. It is capable to parse, modify, or create messages within this schema scope. Use the following to create a schema from a XML schema file. The schemaFilename can point toward a file in the filesystem or a file in the classpath. It is typically done during the program initialization or in a static block. 
     
     // configure the schema usage. Turn off the safeMode for production use. 
     SBEMessageSchema.configSafeMode(false);
     
     // create SBEMessageSchema
     SBEMessageSchema schema = SBEMessageSchema.createSchema(schemaFilename);
     
     // use one of the wrap calls to parse a buffer 
     SBEMessage aMessage = schema.wrapSbeBuffer(...);
     
     // use one of the create  calls to create a sbe message
     SBEMessage aNewMessage = schema.createSbeBuffer(templateId, ...);
     
     // one can also examine all message definitions in the schema
     HashMap<Integer, SBEMessage> definitions = schema.getMsgLookup()
     ...
    Author:
    yzhou

    • Constructor Detail

      • SBEMessageSchema

        public SBEMessageSchema(SBEMessageSchemaHeader schemaHeader,
                        SBEMessageHeader msgHeader,
                        FieldHeader grpHeader,
                        FieldHeader varHeader,
                        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,SBEMessage> lookupTable)
        The constructor is provided for internal use. Use createSBESchema(String) instead.
        Parameters:
        schemaHeader - the schema header
        msgHeader - the message header
        grpHeader - the group header
        varHeader - the variable length field header
        lookupTable - a lookup table contains all messages defined in this schema

    • Method Detail

      • createSBESchema

        public static SBEMessageSchema createSBESchema(java.lang.String xmlDefinition)
                                        throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                               javax.xml.bind.JAXBException
        Create the message schema based upon the SBE XML.
        Parameters:
        xmlDefinition - the SBE xml template filename. It can be in a classpath or filesystem
        Returns:
        a SBEMessageSchema to parse or create SBE messages.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the SBE xml schema file cannot be found
        javax.xml.bind.JAXBException - if there is an error in parsing the SBE xml schema file

      • configSafeMode

        public static void configSafeMode(boolean safeMode)
        If safeMode is true, there are additional checks against the runtime error caused by erroneous logic implementation. This value can also be turned on/off by specifying -DsafeMode=ture/false
        Parameters:
        safeMode - false to turn off the safe mode for better performance

      • setOptimizedNumOfGroups

        public static void setOptimizedNumOfGroups(int number)
        Set an optimized value for number of groups. It is a balance between the memory usage and occasionally performance impact. There is a performance punishment to increase the internal memory when the number of groups in a message exceeds this value. This value can also be set by specifying -DoptimizedNumOfGroups=128 (default)
        Parameters:
        number - optimized value

      • setOptimizedNumOfGroupRows

        public static void setOptimizedNumOfGroupRows(int number)
        Set an optimized value for number of group rows. It is a balance between the memory usage and occasionally performance impact. There is a performance punishment to increase the internal memory when the number of group rows for a group in a message exceeds this value. This value can also be set by specifying -DoptimizedNumOfGroupRows=8 (default)
        Parameters:
        number - optimized value

      • wrapSbeBuffer

        public GroupObject wrapSbeBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
                                 int offset)
        Create a GroupObject based upon a buffer. All SBE fields in the buffer are accessible via the GroupObject. The current SBE message size is the sum of the GroupObject size and the SBE message header size.
        Parameters:
        buffer - containing a complete SBE message.
        offset - the starting position of the message.
        Returns:
        GroupObject to access SBE fields

      • wrapSbeBuffer

                                 int offset)
        Create a GroupObject based upon a buffer. All SBE fields in the buffer are accessible via the GroupObject. The current SBE message size is the sum of the GroupObject size and the SBE message header size.
        Parameters:
        buffer - containing a complete SBE message.
        offset - the starting position of the message.
        Returns:
        GroupObject to access SBE fields

      • wrapSbeBuffer

        public GroupObject wrapSbeBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
                                 int offset,
                                 int length)
        Create a GroupObject based upon a buffer. All SBE fields in the buffer are accessible via the GroupObject. The current SBE message size is the sum of the GroupObject size and the SBE message header size.
        Parameters:
        buffer - containing a complete SBE message.
        offset - the starting position of the message.
        length - it is no less than the size of the whole SBE message including the message header.
        Returns:
        GroupObject to access SBE fields

      • wrapSbeBuffer

        public GroupObject wrapSbeBuffer(byte[] buffer,
                                 int offset,
                                 int length)

        Parameters:
        buffer - containing a complete SBE message.
        offset - the starting position of the message.
        length - it is no less than the size of the whole SBE message including the message header.
        Returns:
        GroupObject to access SBE fields

      • createSbeBuffer

        public GroupObject createSbeBuffer(int templateId,
                                   java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
                                   int offset)
        Create a SBE message using the provided buffer.
        Parameters:
        templateId - the target message template ID
        buffer - the buffer for building SBE message
        offset - the starting position of the message
        Returns:
        a GroupObject to set values for fields in this message or null if the message cannot be created.

      • createSbeBuffer

                                   byte[] buffer,
                                   int offset)
        Create a SBE message using the provided buffer.
        Parameters:
        templateId - the target message template ID
        buffer - the buffer for building SBE message
        offset - the starting position of the message
        Returns:
        a GroupObject to set values for fields in this message or null if the message cannot be created.

      • getMsgLookup

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,SBEMessage> getMsgLookup()
        Obtain a hash map contains all SBEMessage definitions found in the current schema. The message template ID is the key.
        Returns:
        a HashMap containing all available message definitions in the schema
